title: Trump extends deadline to keep TikTok running in US
snippets: The president has granted the app a second 75-day extension to comply with a law that requires it to either sell its US assets or face a ban.
summary: The president has issued a second 75-day extension for an app to meet the requirements of a law mandating the sale of its US assets or risk being banned. This decision allows the app additional time to comply with the legislation.
titles: Trump extends deadline to keep TikTok running in US

title: Demonstrators rally across Spain to protest against housing crisis
snippets: Demonstrators have returned to the streets in anger over high housing costs with no relief in sight.
summary: Demonstrators have taken to the streets again due to frustration over escalating housing costs, indicating that there has been no significant relief or solution provided to address the issue. This ongoing protest highlights the public's dissatisfaction with the current state of housing affordability.
titles: Demonstrators rally across Spain to protest against housing crisis

title: Israel admits mistakes over medic killings in Gaza
snippets: Israeli forces shot dead 15 emergency workers in a convoy of ambulances near Rafah on 23 March.
summary: On 23 March, Israeli forces killed 15 emergency workers in a convoy of ambulances near Rafah.
titles: Israel admits mistakes over medic killings in Gaza

title: Anti-Trump protests in cities across US declare 'hands off'
snippets: Thousands of protesters have gathered for the most visible opposition movement of Trump's second term.
summary: Thousands of individuals have convened in a significant protest against Donald Trump during his second term in office, marking the most visible opposition movement against his presidency to date.
titles: Anti-Trump protests in cities across US declare 'hands off'

title: Trump urges US to 'hang tough' as 10% tariffs come into effect
snippets: It comes on the largest day of protests against Trump's administration since he returned to office.
summary: Nationwide protests against President Trump's administration marked the largest turnout since his return to office. Demonstrators across the country voiced their opposition to policies and decisions made by the current administration, highlighting widespread discontent. The events were peaceful, with organizers emphasizing the importance of civic engagement and public dissent.
titles: Trump urges US to 'hang tough' as 10% tariffs come into effect

title: Bird, Moore, Melo, Donovan lead '25 HOF class
snippets: Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Carmelo Anthony and Dwight Howard are among those selected for enshrinement into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.
summary: Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Carmelo Anthony, and Dwight Howard have been selected for induction into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. This recognition celebrates their significant contributions and achievements in basketball.
titles: Bird, Moore, Melo, Donovan lead '25 HOF class

title: Duke's Flagg 4th freshman to win Wooden Award
snippets: Duke's Cooper Flagg is the winner of the 2025 Wooden Award, becoming just the fourth freshman in the award's history to earn the award.
summary: Cooper Flagg, a freshman at Duke, has won the 2025 Wooden Award, marking him as the fourth freshman ever to receive this honor. The award recognizes the most outstanding college basketball player in the United States.
titles: Duke's Flagg 4th freshman to win Wooden Award

title: Rodman scores in return as USWNT beats Brazil
snippets: Trinity Rodman took just five minutes to to make her mark on her long-awaited return to the United States women's national team, opening the scoring in a 2-0 win over Brazil at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, on Saturday.
summary: Trinity Rodman made a notable return to the United States women's national team by scoring within five minutes of the game against Brazil. This early goal contributed to the team's 2-0 victory at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, on Saturday.
titles: Rodman scores in return as USWNT beats Brazil

title: Red Sox's Campbell: 'Couldn't pass up' $60M deal
snippets: Red Sox rookie Kristian Campbell called his new eight-year, $60 million deal a "life-changing opportunity" and something he "couldn't pass up."
summary: Red Sox rookie Kristian Campbell signed an eight-year contract worth $60 million, describing it as a "life-changing opportunity" that he "couldn't pass up." This significant deal marks a major milestone in Campbell's career with the Red Sox.
titles: Red Sox's Campbell: 'Couldn't pass up' $60M deal

title: Corporate America fears wrath of Trump as it mulls tariffs response
snippets: Executives unsure how far to go in re-engineering their businesses and hope they can lobby US president to ease policies
summary: Executives are currently uncertain about the extent of changes needed in re-engineering their businesses. They are hopeful that through lobbying, they can persuade the US president to moderate policies that affect their operations.
titles: Corporate America fears wrath of Trump as it mulls tariffs response

title: Tariff deals with foreign governments not a priority for Trump, say US officials
snippets: After markets tumble, president reiterates that his policies ‘will never change’ in social media post
summary: Following a significant downturn in the markets, the president reaffirmed his commitment to his current policies, stating in a social media post that his approach 'will never change.' This declaration comes in the wake of market instability, underscoring the president's steadfast stance on his policy direction despite economic fluctuations.
titles: Tariff deals with foreign governments not a priority for Trump, say US officials

title: In charts: winners and losers from Trump’s new tariffs
snippets: Low rates on Ireland, high levies on Slovakia, Asian misery and the strange tale of St Pierre and Miquelon
summary: Ireland experiences low tax rates, while Slovakia faces high levies. Asian countries are currently enduring economic difficulties. Additionally, the unique situation of St Pierre and Miquelon, a small French territory, is highlighted without detailed explanation of its circumstances.
titles: In charts: winners and losers from Trump’s new tariffs

title: Direct economics — the great Maga experiment
snippets: The arbitrariness of the tariffs is a feature not a bug in the plan to short-circuit the financial establishment
summary: The strategy behind the implementation of tariffs is deliberately arbitrary, aiming to disrupt the traditional financial systems. This approach is not accidental but a calculated part of the plan.
titles: Direct economics — the great Maga experiment

title: Tens of thousands join protests against Donald Trump and Elon Musk
snippets: Demonstrations mark the first big display of public resistance to president’s frenetic second term
summary: Demonstrations have emerged as the first significant public opposition to the president's active second term. These protests represent a notable shift in public sentiment, showcasing widespread resistance to the current administration's policies and direction.
titles: Tens of thousands join protests against Donald Trump and Elon Musk

title: Mechanistic understanding could enable better fast-charging batteries
snippets: An innovative new computational model developed by an engineer could lead to fast-charging lithium-ion batteries that are safer and longer-lasting.
summary: An engineer has developed a new computational model aimed at improving lithium-ion batteries. This innovation promises to make batteries charge faster, safer, and extend their lifespan.
titles: Mechanistic understanding could enable better fast-charging batteries

title: No bones about it: New details about skeletal cell aging revealed
snippets: Scientists and researchers around the globe are investigating a series of mysteries about what happens to our bones over time.
summary: Scientists worldwide are conducting research to understand the changes that occur in human bones as we age. This global effort aims to uncover the mysteries behind bone density loss, structural changes, and overall bone health over time.
titles: No bones about it: New details about skeletal cell aging revealed

title: New research boosts future whooping cough vaccines
snippets: New research could aid in improving whooping cough vaccines to once again push this disease toward eradication by targeting two key weaknesses in the infection.
summary: Recent research has identified two critical vulnerabilities in the whooping cough infection, potentially paving the way for enhanced vaccines. These advancements could significantly bolster efforts to eradicate the disease by improving the efficacy of current immunization strategies against whooping cough.
titles: New research boosts future whooping cough vaccines

title: An antiviral chewing gum to reduce influenza and herpes simplex virus transmission
snippets: Low vaccination rates for influenza viruses and the lack of an HSV vaccine underscore the need for a new approach to reduce viral transmission. Researchers have now used a clinical-grade antiviral chewing gum to substantially reduce viral loads of two herpes simplex viruses and two influenza A strains in experimental models.
summary: Researchers have developed a clinical-grade antiviral chewing gum that significantly reduces viral loads of two herpes simplex viruses and two influenza A strains in experimental models. This innovation highlights a potential new strategy to combat low vaccination rates for influenza and the absence of a vaccine for HSV by reducing viral transmission through an alternative method.
titles: An antiviral chewing gum to reduce influenza and herpes simplex virus transmission

title: Researchers reveal why young plants may be more vulnerable to disease
snippets: A new study reveals an evolutionary trade-off that young plants face to develop disease resistance.
summary: A recent study has discovered that young plants experience an evolutionary trade-off in developing disease resistance. This finding highlights the balance young plants must achieve between growth and defending against diseases. The study provides insight into the complex evolutionary strategies plants use to survive.
titles: Researchers reveal why young plants may be more vulnerable to disease
